page.title: 18Forestry, Bridgham
page.content:
Our area has typical Breckland light, sandy and gravelly soils, ideal for the Forestry Commission's needs. Silviculture, in the l930's when our area was first planted as part of Thetford Forest, represented the best form of land use, whilst affording potential employment. We have stands of Corsican Pine and Scots Pine, with more recently planted deciduous margins.
Many of the conifers are now reaching maturity and will be felled for pit props and fencing posts. It is hoped that replanting will take place, not only because of the country's timber shortage, but also because these areas provide a haven for wildlife, a valuable area of recreation for many visitors and jobs for our village. (However, see Gravel Plan, p.13.)
